 'edge' or 'border' science. This is the province of theoretical constructs=

e physical sciences. Unfortunately, this research has not yet advanced to t=
hat stage. And for that reason, it is premature to suggest that such proofs=
 should be expected at this juncture. 

  We use terms like 'suggests' and =
'implies' precisely for this reason. Nothing is known for certain, and it w=
ould be (and is) irresponsible to suggest to the contrary at this point. 

=
  What we seek in our models is consistency with observations. What I have =
done here is to provide reports of observations which suggest a coherent li=
nk that in turn provides one possible explanation to the phenomena in quest=
ion.

on of a phenomenon were due to discarnate activity. This means that no alte=
rnative explanation is allowable. Hundreds of quite brilliant people have t=
ried for well over a century to find this one thing and thus far, have been=
 unsuccessful.

  > Let's examine the supporting evidence a bit more closely. First c=
onsider the potential link between healing and PK. Both phenomena can occur=
 due to a local or distant agent. Absent healing for example would be the d=
istant analogy to distank or remote PK. Both have been studied in controlle=
d experiments. Dr Larry Dossy in Texas is one of the primary investigators =
in healing research. Both healing and general PK are reliably observed to b=
e either intentional or spontaneous. So both exhibit similar traits. Both i=
nvolve apparent manipulation by the mind of the physical environment. And c=
ertainly healing strongly implicates an indirect effect on complex systems.=
 So it makes some sense that the two may indeed be related.
  > 
  > Now le=
t's turn to the evidence for PK as an explanation for the EVP. A close coll=
eague of mine, a respected parapsychologist in Los Angeles, was working yea=
rs ago in a well-known haunted site in the Hollywood area. He recorded the =
voice of the home's owner, while standing next to the man. During this inte=
rval the man did not speak; no one heard what was recorded until it was pla=
yed back. This sounds like a classic EVP thus far. The playback was easily =
heard by all. The man recognized his own voice, including swear words; he h=
ad a penchant for swearing in his normal speech. This anecdotal story would=
 suggest that PK could be an explanation for EVPs based on this single exam=
ple alone. 
  > 
  > Lastly we'll consider a recent experiment by Dr. Dean =
Radin. In this experiment, mediators were asked to influence which paths ph=
otons would take passing through one of two very tiny slits. You would expe=
ct this to occur normally by random chance, producing an equal distribution=
 of photons in two regions on the target photograph. When uninfluenced, thi=
s is exactly what happened. When the mediator tried to 'block' one of the s=
lits, the distribution shifted, indicating success. But this is not what's =
important - it is necessary background. For the next trial, the machine was=
 turned on and the exposure taken with no influence attempted. In fact, the=
 mediatator was not even present. The following day the mediatator was aske=
d to influence the machine. He was not told the machine was turned off and =
could not even record at that time. The next day the image was inspected fo=
r the first time - the meditator again was not present. The image revealed =
a pattern similar to the one produced when the mediatator successfully "blo=
cked" the slit in the first trial. Theoretical physicst Dr. Richard Stroup =
suggested this indicated to him a demonstration of what he calls "retrocaus=
ation" - a notion in theoretical physics that the future actually impacts o=
n the past (as well as the past impacting the future as most people believe=
). Dr. Radin raised an interesting point with respect to designing experime=
nts. He now wonders if investigators are so entangled with experiments that=
 they unwittingly can influence outcomes even before the experiment is desi=
gned. Remember, these are trained academicians at the top of their respecti=
ve fields.

ediate what is done; I simply wonder if they are really manipulating sound =
directly.
